metadata.title: CVE-2021-23982 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Using techniques that built on the slipstream research, a malicious webpagecould have scanned both an internal network's hosts as well as servicesrunning on the user's local machine utilizing WebRTC connections. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
